ElementWebkitmouseforcewillbegin_event.summary: Safari for macOS fires the non-standard webkitmouseforcewillbegin event at an before firing the initial event.

remarks.para: This offers the opportunity to tell the system not to trigger any default Force Touch actions if and when the click turns into a Force Touch event.
To instruct macOS not to engage any default Force Touch actions if the user apply enough pressure to activate a Force Touch event, call on the webkitmouseforcewillbegin event object.
webkitmouseforcewillbegin is a proprietary, WebKit-specific event. It is part of the Force Touch events feature.
